page.title: 03BOURNE TOWN HALL
page.content: In a dominant postion overlooking the market place stands{Bourne Town {Hall.}It was designed by Bryan Browning and built in 1821. Outside is a clock which keeps good time which Brunnians tend to rely on this when shopping or going to work.Inside is a courtroom where law breakers are judged and sentenced every{Quarter or {Petty Session. On special occasions such as Remembrance Day and Bourne's traditional New Year's Eve {Celebrations}the Mayor stands on the platform at the top of the steps and speaks to the people of Bourne. There was once a shambles underneath the Town Hall but now only the scaffolding of the market stalls is kept there.At{Christmas}time the Mayor switches on the fairy lights{ from the top steps of the Town Hall.
